5526783.contents:
Pilotly is the first self-service insights platform for media content- we make complex research simple, fast and cost effective. Through our interactive video platform, we are able to collect detailed consumer feedback rapidly from specific target audiences, and then process the data using our A.I. algorithms to surface valuable insights to our clients. We’re in a unique position to completely change the consumer insights landscape affecting culture around the world, because, after all, the most influential communications leverage video. Help us become the platform of records for every organization, small to large, that needs to optimize the outcome of their video.

Every day we’re collecting hundreds of thousands of data points from our research studies. Whether it’s a response to a question, a user interaction with our video experience or an implicit activity we derive insight from, there is always data being collected during a Pilotly experience. While we process this data to surface insights for clients, there is a bigger picture opportunity here. We can look at data across industries to surface market trends, identify new performance indicators that leverage our depth of respondent data and match our 1st party with 3rd party data to produce new valuable insights.

Using your background in math, statistics and computer science, we’re excited for you to turn our millions of consumer data points into a playground of valuable information for our clients.

Overall Expectation
*As Pilotly continues to grow at an accelerating rate, we need someone who can fully digest the breadth of consumer data that we have and arrange it into a symphony of insights that can both improve our product and help customers. You’re to be the one who ensures that none of our data is dormant. *

| A Good Baseline to Start from
-Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (applied mathematics, statistics, computer science, physics, or other related field) from an academic institution

-Expert in Python and SQL, as well as experience with MongoDb

-Excellent communication skills with demonstrated success presenting complex data and analysis in a clear and compelling manner that inspires action

-Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques used in market research

-Quick learner, with the ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance

-Preferably experienced with dataset from TV data providers like Nielsen and Comscore

| Your Daily Grind
-Support research services with complex data analysis and validation of certain consumer insight assertions

-Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how users interact with our products

-Keep research norms up to date, using this data to create new and better ways to quickly inform clients of their content’s overall performance

-Mine Pilotly data to extract actionable insights that inform, influence, support, and help execute our product decisions and launches. While mining data you’ll be working to surface new key metrics that tie tightly to content performance, giving us new ways to provide value to our clients

-Design and implement reporting and metrics that track and monitor the performance of our products, the quality of our data, and overall health of the business

| Why Pilotly
-We’re always building new media technology that keeps us ahead of the market

-We are affecting culture, so we must be purveyors of culture, our team reflects that. We pride ourselves on keeping the Pilotly team diverse and versatile in thought

-Every day is a different experience when you work with video, one day you’re talking with the creators of your favorite TV show and the next you’re meeting an influencer that a brand is creating content around

-Stay creative, everyone on our team does. Work with people who don’t just geek on out on technology, we have lives outside of the 60 hour weeks

-Health benefits available

-Oh and unlimited paid time off

We are looking for a Mulesoft Architect to build and scale the b atomic API development team.

In this role you'll get ...

  • Assist in architecting technical solutions for enterprise systems using the MuleSoft product suite and adapt to a rapidly changing business environment Knowledge of SOA

  • Design patterns for building middleware systems ground up using Message Routing, Content Enrichment, Message Filtering, Message Transformation, Guaranteed delivery, Message sequencing, Batch message processing, error handling and reconciliation mechanisms.

  • Knowledge of Web Services Interoperability, WS-* standards and ability to suggest, criticize and formulate solutions in a multi-vendor and architecture committee meetings.

  • Identify, analyze and design integration flows using Mule ESB Anypoint Studio and technically own and manage the process of ensuring on time and on budget build and integration of the various elements of the solution

  • Good understanding of integration design patterns & best practices

  • In depth experience using Agile, Scrum and iterative development practices

  • Assist on technical POC's to prove out technology and ultimately leading into selection.

On day one we'll expect you to have...

Solution Architects assess a project’s technical feasibility, as well as implementation risks. They are responsible for designing and implementing a project’s technical architecture. They define the structure of a system, its interfaces, and the principles that guide its organization, software design and implementation. The scope of the Solution Architect’s role is bounded by the business issue at hand. A Solution Architect needs to have knowledge of all the different aspects of the technical solution as well as robust business knowledge. This includes the Software Architect.

  • 3+ years of experience working as an Integration Solution Architect and 1+ with Mulesoft product Suite.

  • 5+ years of software development experience. Experience with large Full Life Cycle (FLC) project implementations, with hands on delivery.

  • Experience with all aspects of the system implementation process of system design, configuration, customization, integration, testing and support.

  • Experience with design, development and deployment of SOA based architecture for a large organization leveraging multiple COTS Business applications is preferred Experience with Tomcat, XML, JMS, XSLT, WS-*, SOA/Integration, and API Management technologies and standards Experience with using a JAVA IDE (Eclipse, Intelli J, Netbeans)

  • Designed and developed micro-service solutions, Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) concepts including REST-ful and SOAP-based services Designed and developed enterprise services using RAML and REST based APIs Experienced in both Agile and waterfall methodologies

  • Have excellent interpersonal, verbal and written skills and the ability to interact with all level of stakeholders, support personnel, and clients Strong documentation, analytical and problem-solving skills Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or any related field and a minimum of 5 years relevant experience providing IT enablement solutions

  • Mule certification highly preferred

Added bonuses you have...

You are responsible for the end-to-end architecture of a solution, including its assembly and integration into the IT architecture principles defined with the client. You define the structure of the system, its interfaces, and the principles that guide its organization, software design and implementation. You are responsible for the management and mitigation of technical risks, ensuring that the solution services can be realistically delivered by the underlying technology components

  • Certification: Technical certification e.g. Cisco, VMWare; or achieved professional certification TOGAF 9 level 1; or has / seeking IAF level 1.

  • Should have experience in Functional Architecture Design and Architecture Knowledge, Negotiating, Financial Analysis and Continuous (Service) Improvement.

  • Should be proficient in Business Knowledge, Software Engineering Leadership, Technical Solution Design and Change Management.

  • Should have progressing knowledge in Business Analysis

6437741.contents:
Broadridge Quality Assurance Analyst/Business Analyst is primarily responsible for understanding financial related communication(s) regarding simple to moderately complex testing requirements, scripting, execution, and reporting of those test results for the following types of tests: automated and manual, positive and negative, and regression, integration, system and smoke testing. The analyst is also involved in change management and documentation. Other tasks as assigned.

In addition, this position may also include Business Analysis and Content System Configuration within our proprietary print and digital content management system, as outlined below.

This position is open to Remote.

Analysis
- In order to gain an understanding of the testing requirements, analyze simple to moderately complex requirements documents, design specifications, and functional specifications with applicable Broadridge departments (e.g. product management, development, etc.) as well as other key stakeholders (sponsor, end customer, etc.).
Planning/Scripting
- Attend change management meetings with Development and Product teams to review current changes in each release cycle.
- Participate in the preparation of comprehensive test plans and scripts for new and changed functionality as per department policies and procedures for the following: automated and manual; positive and negative; regression, integration, system, and smoke testing.
- Ensure all documentation and scripts are maintained and kept up to date with application changes.
- Perform and/or review the checks necessary to ensure that all code changes have been made known to QA, and that all changes have the necessary approvals.

Testing
- Perform the following testing for new and changed functionality to ensure that requirements have been met, that system behavior is as expected and determine that the system is suitable for release: automated and manual; positive and negative; regression, integration, system, and smoke testing.
- Identify points of failure by tracing them to the original source code, where applicable.
- Provide testing support on production issues.
- Liaise with the development teams on testing discrepancies identified.

Reporting
- Document, communicate, and track all testing results.
- Record testing discrepancies in the defect tracking system, including the necessary information to identify
or recreate them.

Business Analysis, tasks as needed (under the guidance of a Senior Associate)
- Work to understand client business requirements and recommend solutions to create customized content for print and electronic marketing communications pieces. Other tasks as assigned
- Data mapping of client feeds
- Identifying business logic and working with the client and internal teams on design and manufacturing implications
- Other tasks include:
- Preparation of user documentation
- Configuration of systems/writing business rules
- Providing client training
- Serving as a resource for the IT/QA teams during implementation and testing

Education and Experience Requirements
- 0-2 years’ experience in marketing or financial services or equivalent education
- Degree in IT related field
- Experience writing Excel Macros and writing/understanding business logic statements
- Recent college graduates encouraged to apply
- Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word)

Specialized training
- None

Certification(s)
- ISTQB Foundation Level Certification (Preferred)

The Head of Site Reliability Engineering will be responsible for leading, growing and motivating a set of robust and hardworking engineers. The ideal candidate will in addition to possessing excellent leadership skills will also be a highly skilled system engineer with knowledge of code and automation. They will also have a strong aim to improve existing systems and processes to advance the way our hardware, software, and network solutions are designed and deployed.

Responsibilities:
- Drive GTO SRE strategy across the Portfolio of products and associated SRE teams within the GTO business segment

To ensure Portfolio SRE teams
- Have effective capabilities for ensuring production uptime and stability as well as the observability, reliability, availability, performance, capacity planning and operational support for the products across GTO.
- Have effective processes for continuous improvements to improve Service Level Objectives (SLO) and mean time to identification (MTTI), mean time to resolution (MTTR), and mean time to failure (MTTF).
- Can effectively engage in incident management and have well defined procedures for the identification of relationships between processes and events, and their root cause.
- Focus on automation; in the context of self-healing, auto-remediation, removing manual toil, orchestration tooling and infrastructure-as-code patterns.
- Ensure that the systems can withstand 'chaos engineering' practices and can fail gracefully when services are degraded
- Ensure the means exist to quickly recover a degraded service (instrumentation, runbooks, tooling etc).
- Ensure adequate instrumentation and alerting exists to spot leading indicators of an impending incident in the system; as well as in systems on which the platform depends.
1. Provide leadership in iteratively defining & refining engineering processes and adoption strategies as the SRE practice grows. Motivate, lead and develop a team of diverse Portfolio SRE managers.
2. Drive SRE education across the Portfolios to improve quality and reliability
3. Directly collaborate with Portfolio SRE Managers and their Portfolio technology and product stakeholders to understand their strategies and needs and incorporate them into GTO SRE strategy.
4. Provide strategy, process and tooling so that Portfolio SRE Managers can effectively and consistently communicate service reliability, performance and superior customer experience metrics to their respective Portfolio technology and business partners.

Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. (BR), a $4 billion global Fintech leader and part of the S&P 500® Index, is a leading provider of investor communications and technology-driven solutions to banks, broker-dealers, asset and wealth managers and corporate issuers. At Broadridge, we do well by doing good. Our unique culture is guided by the Service-Profit Chain—the idea that success is mutual, directly connecting employee engagement, client satisfaction, and the creation of stockholder value. We enable better financial lives by powering investing, governance, and communications for our clients, their customers, and the financial services industry.

Broadridge Advisor Solutions is looking for a Senior Digital Marketing Strategist to join a fast-paced team that helps financial professionals and institutions grow measurably and compliantly across digital channels! We produce some of the industry’s best educational content—explaining sophisticated financial issues in terms that everyone can understand—and we want you to join us in putting that content to work, helping us improve action and engagement.

In this Senior level role, we will collaborate to build and implement our content dissemination strategy, help us to improve audience engagement and action by optimizing analytics and insights to match audience to content type, topic, and consumption preference. Most importantly, this role interacts daily with a top-tier team of professionals. Does this opportunity sound exciting? If so, we would love for you to apply! Continue reading below.

Responsibilities and Duties:
It is our responsibility to understand our clients’ needs, be transparent, and help craft product capabilities to meet those needs. Interact directly with financial advisors and participate in discussions with financial institutions to understand how we can help them grow their businesses by improving inbound traffic and leads. We also coordinate and are the public face of our social advertising lead generation program. We contact clients and represent the program to internal partners. We also will pursue the holistic metrics that enable us to connect the dots and understand the most effective communications to drive the most predictable results in a cross-channel customer model. We will work to improve CTR, conversion rates, and volume through continuous testing efforts across multiple digital channels. Teamwork is important as this team collaborates with digital designers, channel professionals, product managers, and leadership to drive and define inbound digital capability product roadmaps. Our work will collaborate with content team to plan, design, build, deploy, and improve targeted content campaigns across distribution channels, organic search, paid search, email and social media.

This is a key position within the organization, reporting to the Vice President of Content Agency. We will be interacting daily with members of the larger content, design, analytics, and product teams, who will be looking to you for teamwork on content and product development efforts.

Qualifications
- 5-7 years of proven digital marketing experience and a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising or Digital Marketing is preferred
- Content marketing experience coupled with knowledge of inbound performance marketing strategies and lead generation techniques. Understanding of key digital communications technologies including search marketing, digital advertising, e-mail marketing and social platforms.
- Experience in cross referencing digital analytics, social media metrics, and paid advertising analytics to view conversions across different attribution styles.
- Experience crafting, executing, and optimizing multi-channel, digital campaigns
- Knowledge of creation of custom audiences, lookalike audiences, customer lifetime value audiences, and interest-based audiences
- Ability to identify and implement design changes to websites based on customer heat map data to improve engagement
- Strong communication and collaboration skills; willing to improve the knowledge and skills of those on the team
- Innovative, creative, and proactive attitude
- Basic project management skills required—responsible for overall coordination, tracking, and deadline deliverables

About us

Share Local Media, or SLM, is a rapidly growing startup reimagining the world of offline marketing for tech and e-commerce companies. We started as e-commerce marketers ourselves, and launched SLM with a goal of turning direct mail into a high performing, scalable channel for a digitally native client set. To do so, we’ve taken an inputs based-approach to the space, and re-engineered the channel from the ground up to make it easier to test, faster to execute, more measurable, and ultimately, more effective for e-commerce and tech clients of all types.

So what does SLM actually do? We’re a full-service direct mail agency, media program operator, and technology platform, serving some of your favorite e-commerce and tech brands (think Casper, Lyft, Grubhub, etc.). We live and breathe direct response marketing, and strive to delight clients with high performing campaigns built around fast, data-driven client service, and premium, unique branding.

What are we like at SLM? We’re passionate, humble, and kind. We value data-driven thinking, speed, persistence, creativity, and teamwork. We love helping clients grow and scale through a tactile medium that has long term brand value. And finally, we get excited about transforming an old-school channel into something new through data, product, technology, and a service-driven mentality.

Share our excitement? Great - we’d love to hear from you!

The Role

Data underpins our entire business. It enables us to develop data-driven marketing strategies for our clients, provide robust attribution reporting on our campaigns and deliver compelling features within our SaaS platform.

We are looking for an inquisitive and self-driven Data Engineer to help us build and maintain our internal data platform and infrastructure. You may be working with internal stakeholders, developing functionality to enable internal tools that ingest data from a variety of sources and provide insights into our data.

Being one of the go-to data specialists within our organization, you will support the effective troubleshooting of technical issues such as database performance issues, and failed ETL jobs. You will work closely with a team of Data Analysts & Scientists, developing robust solutions and automations to optimize their workflows and to make data available and accessible across the organization.

Core Responsibilities

  • Building infrastructure for ETL of data from various sources with reliable exception handling.
  • Building and implementing analytical tools to utilize the data pipeline, providing actionable insights into key business performance metrics.
  • Management and structuring of data within our data warehouse, to be consumed by downstream applications.
  • Monitoring the overall performance and stability of our data infrastructure, implementing improvements and optimizations as necessary.
  • Scaling and iterating on data processes as we grow.
  • Working with stakeholders across the organization and assisting them with data-related technical issues and developing solutions.

Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience building cloud-based data infrastructure. (AWS Preferred.)
  • Strong experience with data warehouse design and management.
  • Strong experience building cloud-based data pipelines, data integration and data processing.
  • Strong Python and SQL skills, and proven experience working with major database platforms. (Postgres & Redshift preferred.)
  • Strong understanding of data science concepts and hands-on data analysis skills.
  • Hands-on experience with ETL tools such as AWS Glue, Airflow and DBT.
  • Strong analytical skills & an eye for detail.
  • Comfortable with tackling loosely defined problems with autonomy in day-to-day decisions.

Nice to Have

  • Experience with maintaining data infrastructure using Terraform or similar infrastructure-as-code tools.
  • Experience processing and handling customer PII and applicable privacy and security standards.
  • Experience implementing and managing BI tools.
  • Knowledge of the marketing ecosystem and understanding of common metrics.
  • Data engineering certifications (e.g. IBM Certified Data Engineer)
  • Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment.

What we offer

  • Full-time role based in our NYC office
  • Ownership and growth opportunities
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • Robust benefits package
  • A fun culture including: team events, happy hours, and trips (Currently Virtual)
  • The opportunity to work with a group of passionate, humble, and kind team members

If you’re looking to be part of something new that is transforming an industry, this is the role for you. You will be empowered to think like an entrepreneur by coming up with new ideas, testing them, implementing them, and then scaling them quickly.

Broadridge is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer! We need someone to focus on improving service reliability, performance, and operability of Services. Your hand on the pulse of the service and will play a key role in solving problems and resolving service issues. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to build future automation and tooling that will allow us to continuously improve our service.

Does this sound interesting? We would love for you to apply!

Key Job Functions/Responsibilities
In this role, we will need you to translate business requirements into technical designs, considering automation, availability, performance, scale, and cost. Ensure technical & security best practices along with Broadridge standards are adhered to in the design of technical infrastructure. Be responsible for the design, implementation, and operational support of the technical infrastructure for strategic Broadridge applications and services. Ensure the continuous health and reliability of the technical infrastructure, and the applications/services it supports, through Service Level Objectives (SLOs), metrics/Service Level Indicators (SLIs) and continuous operational process improvements. Work with Vendors to implement new capabilities and competencies to the Broadridge technical infrastructure.

Lead technical design sessions and works closely with multiple teams, including application development teams, infrastructure teams, vendors, and clients, if needed, to review t he infrastructure designs for new projects. Understand dependencies between infrastructure components, vendor software, custom software and other parts of the processing stack that support Broadridge Services. Work with senior leaders to design solutions with technical vision, sustainability, and total cost of ownership in mind. While also contributing in strategic planning discussions with technical, business, and client stakeholders.

Experience:
- 10+ years of experience working in a similar role within the fin-tech industry at both the infrastructure and software level.
- Experience with Unix and/or Cloud-based solutions such as AWS or Azure.
- Technical understanding of OS, Network, Storage and Databases in large datacenter environments including firewall, anti-virus, proxy, file transfer, and other enterprise-wide software.
- Knowledge of system platforms (i.e. Virtualization, storage, IBM WebSphere MQ, Database technologies, file transfer protocols, encryption, certificates, Proxy, FortiGate firewalls).
- Knowledge and experience with JIRA, Confluence, Git, Jenkins, Terraform, Chef, and PowerShell/Perl/ Shell scripting.
- Prior experience working within a matrixed managed organization, across multiple time zones.
- Able to adapt and embrace change and support business strategy and vision.
- Knowledge of next-generation design patterns/architecture like micro-services, layered pattern, cloud.
- Strong aptitude for learning new skills and new technologies.

Workplace Flexibility
We are committed to supporting flexible work arrangements, investing in technology or other resources to enable you to work from home optimally, wherever possible.

Research prospective client processes and conduct and present cost benefit analysis and ROI. Sr. Solution Analysis and Support Specialists work more independently of sales leads and have the skills and savvy to help advance the sale. Manage challenges and buying signals and respond on the spot based on the pre¬determined sales strategy. Assist the sales team in setting opportunity strategy and plans. Responsibilities can include serving as project lead for opportunities and have the authority to change a project plan if needed. Preferred Qualifications:

Skills/Competencies:

- Extensive phone contact
- Extensive PC usage

- Work involves heavy interactions with senior management

- Extensive financial analysis activities
- Extensive written communication
- Involves multiple, complex sales opportunities running simultaneously
- Ability to work under tight deadlines
